channel.title: Reduction 718 - Command Error
channel.description:
So when I first got my server all set up, and made myself owner all the commands were working and I could do everything. Now that I logged out, and I logged back in today I get this error: [img]http://speedcap.net/sharing/files/cb/02/cb0224e4953694af61103fa6d3ea855a.png[/img]
Then I went in to the character files, and deleted my file Ryan.p and logged in and made myself owner again, and this time it worked except I just lost everything on my account which can be annoying. Can someone please help me?

item.title: Reduction 718 - Command Error
item.dc:creator: @noty noty
item.description:
@noty wrote:

701+ Servers will you have to press there buttons:

SHIFT + and the button left to 1 that would look like this: §

Read full topic

item.title: Reduction 718 - Command Error
item.dc:creator: @thakillah thakillah
item.description:
@thakillah wrote:

or use ;; works for me

Read full topic

item.title: Reduction 718 - Command Error
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

Hazard28:

Why does that happen though? I like using the actual chat for commands

This is just for staff members…
Normal players will need only use ‘’::’’ commands… Make new account and try it out…

You just made yourself look like totally newbie^.^

Read full topic

item.title: Reduction 718 - Command Error
item.dc:creator: @Haydnz1234 Haydnz1234
item.description:
@Haydnz1234 wrote:

you could just use commands in chat, instead of using :: use ;;
E.G: ;;bank, ;;dz, ;;master etc

Read full topic

item.title: Reduction 718 - Command Error
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

You have to use the developer console to type commands… type “`” and it opens the developer console and you just type the command no “::”

Read full topic

item.description:

So when I first got my server all set up, and made myself owner all the commands were working and I could do everything. Now that I logged out, and I logged back in today I get this error:
